data.title: Access violation reading location 0x0000007c. Drawable#GetLightMask
data.body:
My little program spins up and generates a dungeon.  I can hit my G key and it will create a WorkItem to create another dungeon.

The dungeon sits inside a 'dungeonNode' which i clear out before i start creating the drawables from the dungeon data.

I have a little scriptfile that creates my nodes:

```
ShortStringHash CELL_TYPE("CellType");

void ConstructGridCell(Node@ cell)
{
    File@ file = cache.GetFile("Objects/floor.xml");

    if (cell.vars.Contains(CELL_TYPE))
    {
        int cellType = cell.vars[CELL_TYPE].GetInt();
        if (cellType > 0)
        {
            Node@ floor = scene.InstantiateXML(file, cell.position, Quaternion(), LOCAL);
            floor.parent = cell;
        }
    }
}
```

When i don't instance the floors, I don't get the crash.

Here is my stacktrace.

```
>   Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Drawable::GetLightMask()  Line 177 + 0x11 bytes  C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::View::GetLightMask(Urho3D::Drawable * drawable)  Line 229 + 0x1d bytes   C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::View::ProcessLight(Urho3D::LightQueryResult & query, unsigned int threadIndex)  Line 1946 + 0x1d bytes   C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::ProcessLightWork(const Urho3D::WorkItem * item, unsigned int threadIndex)  Line 246  C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::WorkQueue::Complete(unsigned int priority)  Line 177 + 0x10 bytes    C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::View::GetBatches()  Line 780 C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::View::Update(const Urho3D::FrameInfo & frame)  Line 495  C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Renderer::Update(float timeStep)  Line 674   C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Renderer::HandleRenderUpdate(Urho3D::StringHash eventType, Urho3D::HashMap<Urho3D::ShortStringHash,Urho3D::Variant> & eventData)  Line 1801  C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::EventHandlerImpl<Urho3D::Renderer>::Invoke(Urho3D::HashMap<Urho3D::ShortStringHash,Urho3D::Variant> & eventData)  Line 262   C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Object::OnEvent(Urho3D::Object * sender, Urho3D::StringHash eventType, Urho3D::HashMap<Urho3D::ShortStringHash,Urho3D::Variant> & eventData)  Line 78 + 0x13 bytes   C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Object::SendEvent(Urho3D::StringHash eventType, Urho3D::HashMap<Urho3D::ShortStringHash,Urho3D::Variant> & eventData)  Line 280  C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Engine::Update()  Line 534   C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Engine::RunFrame()  Line 357 C++
    Main_d.exe!Urho3D::Application::Run()  Line 69 + 0x16 bytes C++
    Main_d.exe!RunApplication()  Line 4 + 0xe3 bytes    C++
    Main_d.exe!WinMain(HINSTANCE__ * hInstance, HINSTANCE__ * prevInstance, char * cmdLine, int showCmd)  Line 4 + 0x35 bytes   C++
    Main_d.exe!__tmainCRTStartup()  Line 547 + 0x2c bytes   C
    Main_d.exe!WinMainCRTStartup()  Line 371    C
    kernel32.dll!7611495d()     
    [Frames below may be incorrect and/or missing, no symbols loaded for kernel32.dll]  
    ntdll.dll!770698ee()    
    ole32.dll!76a43d57()    
```

data.title: Added Pool for WorkQueue WorkItems
LuaJIT failed to build on windows since commit "Fix LuaJIT build script to add dependency files for luajit executable. "
data.body:
windows 7 64bit
vs2010 and vs2013 both failed.

failed at lib_package.c line 592:
setpath(L, "path", LUA_PATH, LUA_PATH_DEFAULT, noenv);

Error   23  error C1004: unexpected end-of-file found

LUA_PATH_DEFAULT is defined in luaconf.h line 23, which caused the error:
# define LUA_PATH_DEFAULT \

  ".\?.lua;" "!\"LUA_RDIR"?.lua;" LUA_IDIR"?.lua;" LUA_LDIR"?.lua;" LUA_LDIR"?\init.lua;"

Added generator for approximatly normal distributed values
data.body: This should make it possible to create realistic random values, it isnt the best approximation to a normal distribution but pretty fast.

data.title: Fixed OgreImporter link problems on OS X
data.body: OgreImporter fail to link on OS X because of missing frameworks. This pull request adds the correct frameworks by using the setup_macosx_linker_flags() macro.

data.title: Shader refactor
data.body:
This is the shader refactoring project as mentioned in the forum thread: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic29.html
- Shader description XML's are removed. Techniques & renderpath definitions set shader compilation defines directly
- GLSL shaders are combined to one file (.glsl) which contains both the vertex & pixel shaders. They are called VS() and PS() similar to HLSL shaders
- ShaderCompiler utility for D3D9 mode is removed

All techniques, shaders and renderpaths / postprocesses have been converted, but not tested extensively. If you have time, please test and report any errors to this pull request. After necessary fixes I'll then merge this quite soon.

Add simple features for manipulating uncompressed Image objects, also from script:

- Get color of pixel at x,y
- Fill image (whole or a rect) with color

data.title: windows android build - error getting git revision
data.body:
```
[ 68%] Generating GIT revision number (tag + last commit SHA-1)
/bin/sh: -c: line 0: syntax error near unexpected token `%%v'
/bin/sh: -c: line 0: `cd C:/Users/Chris/Desktop/Urho3D/Source && for /F %%v in ( 'git describe --always --dirty' ) do echo const char* revision="%%v"; >C:/Users/Chris/Desktop/Urho3D/android-Build/Engine/gitversion.h'
make[2]: *** [Engine/gitversion.h] Error 2
make[1]: *** [Engine/CMakeFiles/Urho3D.dir/all] Error 2
make: *** [all] Error 2
```

this is where this happens in cmake:

```
# Define generated source files
execute_process (COMMAND git describe --always WORKING_DIRECTORY ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR} RESULT_VARIABLE GIT_EXIT_CODE OUTPUT_QUIET ERROR_QUIET)
if (GIT_EXIT_CODE EQUAL 0)
    if (CMAKE_HOST_WIN32 AND NOT MSYS)
        add_custom_command (OUTPUT ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/gitversion.h
            COMMAND for /F %%v in ('git describe --always --dirty') do echo const char* revision="%%v"\; >${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/gitversion.h DEPENDS ${STATIC_LIBRARY_TARGETS}
            WORKING_DIRECTORY ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}
            COMMENT "Generating GIT revision number (tag + last commit SHA-1)")
    else ()
        add_custom_command (OUTPUT ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/gitversion.h
            COMMAND for v in `git describe --always --dirty`\; do echo 'const char* revision="'$$v'"\;' >${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/gitversion.h\; break\; done DEPENDS ${STATIC_LIBRARY_TARGETS}
            WORKING_DIRECTORY ${PROJECT_SOURCE_DIR}
            COMMENT "Generating GIT revision number (tag + last commit SHA-1)")
    endif ()
else ()
    # No GIT command line tool or not a GIT repository, generate a dummy version file
    file (WRITE ${CMAKE_CURRENT_BINARY_DIR}/gitversion.h "const char* revision=\"Unversioned\";")
endif ()
```

I am running this through make on windows.  I am in a cmd.exe shell.  I don't know how cmake knows if i am in msys or not.  Make is delegating to /bin/sh to run the command but is using the 'not msys' method.

data.title: Custom render path segfault
data.body:
Hi,
It seems that it is possible to trigger a segfault with a specific render path. For example :

``` xml
<renderpath>
    <rendertarget name="rt" sizedivisor="1 1" format="rgba" filter="true" />
    <command type="clear" color="fog" depth="1.0" stencil="0" output="rt" />
    <command type="scenepass" pass="base" vertexlights="true" metadata="base" output="rt" />
    <command type="forwardlights" pass="light" output="rt" />
    <command type="scenepass" pass="postopaque" output="rt" />
    <command type="scenepass" pass="alpha" usescissor="true" vertexlights="true" sort="backtofront" metadata="alpha" output="rt" />
    <command type="scenepass" pass="postalpha" sort="backtofront" output="rt" />
    <command type="quad" tag="CopyFramebuffer" vs="CopyFramebuffer" ps="CopyFramebuffer" output="viewport">
        <texture unit="diffuse" name="rt" />
    </command>
</renderpath>
```

What I expect the renderer to do : render the scene in the render target "rt" then copy it on the viewport.
What it does : it segfaults on View.cpp:1312 : 

``` cpp
currentRenderTarget_ = viewportTextures_[1]->GetRenderSurface();
```

It seems that viewportTextures_ only contains one texture in this case, so viewportTextures_[1] doesn't exists, which explains the segfault.

data.title: Script Compiler: Lua/LuaJIT
data.body:
Hi,
Just as I realized that only AngelScript can be compiled, I think it might be great to imply Lua and LuaJIT bytecoding within this tool for faster loading, sometimes slightly less memory consumption and/or a layer of obfuscation for public releases.

Luac: http://www.lua.org/manual/5.2/luac.html
LuaJIT: http://luajit.org/extensions.html#string_dump

Though this could be done manually aside, this is just a suggestion to standardize the multiple scripting languages' features from a same tool.

Thank you!
